medical_history.chief_complaint: Multiple flat warts on the face, head, and hands.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The warts were of 8 years' duration and previously treated unsuccessfully with various therapies. Initial treatment with interferon gamma resulted in a reduction, but effectiveness decreased after five months. Treatment then shifted to interferon alfa-2b, leading to regression of the warts, though relapses occurred with treatment interruptions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Calv√©-Legg-Perthes syndrome as a child; otherwise, no significant medical history or signs of immunodeficiency.
medical_history.family_history: First-grade relatives had normal CD4 T lymphocyte counts and no widespread warts. There was no consanguinity in the family.
